us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.tools

Class EuclidGeometryRandomTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.tools.EuclidGeometryRandomTools

  • public abstract class EuclidGeometryRandomTools
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides random generators to generate random geometry objects.

    The main application is for writing JUnit Tests.

        Deprecated. Use nextLine2D(Random,double) instead
        Generates a random line 2D.

        • pointi ∈ [-pointMinMax; pointMinMax].
        • directioni ∈ [-1.0; 1.0].

        Parameters:
        random - the random generator to use.
        pointMinMax - the maximum absolute value for each coordinate of the line's point.
        Returns:
        the random line 2D.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if pointMinMax < 0.

      • generateRandomBoundingBox2D

        @Deprecated
public static BoundingBox2D generateRandomBoundingBox2D(java.util.Random random,
                                                                     double centerMinMax,
                                                                     double sizeMax)
        Deprecated. Use nextBoundingBox2D(Random,double,double) instead
        Generates a random bounding box from random center location and random size.
        Parameters:
        random - the random generator to use.
        centerMinMax - the maximum absolute value for each coordinate of the bounding box center.
        sizeMax - the maximum size along each axis for the bounding box.
        Returns:
        the random bounding box.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if centerMinMax < 0 or sizeMax < 0.

public static Pose3D generateRandomPose3D(java.util.Random random)
        Deprecated. Use nextPose3D(Random) instead
        Generates a random pose 3D.

        • positioni ∈ [-1.0; 1.0].
        • orientation.getAngle() ∈ [-pi; pi].

        Parameters:
        random - the random generator to use.
        Returns:
        the random pose 3D.

      • nextPose3D

        public static Pose3D nextPose3D(java.util.Random random,
                                double maxAbsoluteX,
                                double maxAbsoluteY,
                                double maxAbsoluteZ)
        Generates a random pose 3D.

        • positionX ∈ [-maxAbsoluteX; maxAbsoluteX].
        • positionY ∈ [-maxAbsoluteY; maxAbsoluteY].
        • positionZ ∈ [-maxAbsoluteZ; maxAbsoluteZ].
        • orientation.getAngle() ∈ [-pi; pi].

        Parameters:
        random - the random generator to use.
        maxAbsoluteX - the maximum absolute value for the x-coordinate of the position part of the pose 3D.
        maxAbsoluteY - the maximum absolute value for the y-coordinate of the position part of the pose 3D.
        maxAbsoluteZ - the maximum absolute value for the z-coordinate of the position part of the pose 3D.
        Returns:
        the random pose 3D.

      • nextPose3D

        public static Pose3D nextPose3D(java.util.Random random,
                                double positionMinMax,
                                double orientationMinMax)
        Generates a random pose 3D.

        • positioni ∈ [-positionMinMax; positionMinMax].
        • orientation.getAngle() ∈ [-orientationMinMax; orientationMinMax].

        Parameters:
        random - the random generator to use.
        positionMinMax - the maximum absolute value for each coordinate of the pose's position.
        orientationMinMax - the maximum absolute value of the rotation angle for the pose's orientation.
        Returns:
        the random pose 3D.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if positionMinMax < 0 or orientationMinMax < 0.

      • nextConvexPolygon2D

        public static ConvexPolygon2D nextConvexPolygon2D(java.util.Random random,
                                                  double maxAbsoluteXY,
                                                  int numberOfPossiblePoints)
        Generates a random convex polygon given the maximum absolute coordinate value of its vertices and the size of the point cloud from which it is generated.
        Parameters:
        random - the random generator to use.
        maxAbsoluteXY - the maximum absolute value for each coordinate of the vertices.
        numberOfPossiblePoints - the size of the point cloud to generate that is used for computing the random convex polygon. The size of the resulting convex polygon will be less than numberOfPossiblePoints.
        Returns:
        the random convex polygon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if maxAbsoluteXY < 0.

      • generateRandomPointCloud2D

        @Deprecated
public static java.util.List<us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.Point2D> generateRandomPointCloud2D(java.util.Random random,
                                                                                                     double centerMinMax,
                                                                                                     double minMax,
                                                                                                     int numberOfPoints)
        Deprecated. Use nextPointCloud2D(Random,double,double,int) instead
        Generates a random 2D point cloud given a random average, range, and size.
        Parameters:
        random - the random generator to use.
        centerMinMax - the maximum absolute value for each coordinate of the random average.
        minMax - the range of the point cloud in the three directions.
        numberOfPoints - the size of the point cloud to generate.
        Returns:
        the random 2D point cloud.

      • generateRandomCircleBasedConvexPolygon2D

        @Deprecated
public static java.util.List<us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.Point2D> generateRandomCircleBasedConvexPolygon2D(java.util.Random random,
                                                                                                                   double centerMinMax,
                                                                                                                   double maxEdgeLength,
                                                                                                                   int numberOfVertices)
        Deprecated. Use nextCircleBasedConvexPolygon2D(Random,double,double,int) instead
        Generates a random convex polygon 2D which construction is based on the generation of a random circle onto which the vertices are generated.
        Parameters:
        random - the random generator to use.
        centerMinMax - the maximum absolute value for each coordinates of the circle's center.
        maxEdgeLength - maximum distance between two successive vertices constraining the size of the random circle.
        numberOfVertices - the size of the convex polygon.
        Returns:
        the random convex polygon 2D.
